issue.title: Keeping Contact
issue.body:
Hey all,

I would like to continue keeping touch and developing this library further. I propose we all either connect via Slack, or we start a group hangout. I would like to know your guys' opinion on either of these options!

Hangouts: [add me on G+ ](https://plus.google.com/110342829010121213850)
Slack: [email me](mailto:brian@beg.in)

Also you should all add yourselves as contributors to `package.json`!

issue.title: Angular HTML5 Mode
issue.body:
We should add support for Angular HTML5 Mode and a configuration option that disables or enables it.

[See this StackOverflow post](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/31778324/angular-html5-mode-with-express)

issue.title: Hot Reloading JavaScript
issue.body:
This is a far in the future type feature, but I'm considering using some of Chrome's JavaScript hot-reloading features to refresh scripts during development without refreshing the whole page. This issue will serve as documentation through the research process.

AMD modules allow for a hot reload:
https://medium.com/@the1mills/hot-reloading-with-react-requirejs-7b2aa6cb06e1#.2obatx204

Light Table can live edit JavaScript:
https://youtu.be/52SVAMM3V78

issue.title: Versioning Hooks
issue.body:
We need `npm version` hooks that will run the following tasks:
- [ ] `gulp test` - verify build is stable
- [ ] `gulp changelog` - update the `CHANGELOG.md` file
- [ ] `gulp docs` - update the `README.md` file (if necessary)
- [ ] add and commit changed files
- [ ] push the changes and tags to Github

[See the documentation for the `npm version` command](https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/version)

issue.title: Integrate script hooks to npm version command
issue.body: These additions are in response to issue #5.

issue.title: Versioning Hooks
issue.body:
We need `npm version` hooks that will run the following tasks:
- [ ] `gulp test` - verify build is stable
- [ ] `gulp changelog` - update the `CHANGELOG.md` file
- [ ] `gulp docs` - update the `README.md` file (if necessary)
- [ ] add and commit changed files
- [ ] push the changes and tags to Github

[See the documentation for the `npm version` command](https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/version)

issue.title: Add a Gitter chat badge to README.md
issue.body:
### Beg-in/Fritz now has a Chat Room on Gitter

@BrainBacon has just created a chat room. You can visit it here: [https://gitter.im/Beg-in/Fritz](https://gitter.im/Beg-in/Fritz?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&content=body_link).

This pull-request adds this badge to your README.md:

[![Gitter](https://badges.gitter.im/Beg-in/Fritz.svg)](https://gitter.im/Beg-in/Fritz?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&utm_content=body_badge)

If my aim is a little off, please [let me know](https://github.com/gitterHQ/readme-badger/issues).

Happy chatting.

PS: [Click here](https://gitter.im/settings/badger/opt-out) if you would prefer not to receive automatic pull-requests from Gitter in future.

issue.title: Create a development branch
issue.body: I created a development branch so we can develop in a more organized fashion. Master should contain only the most stable version.
